item.title: 26 Oct 2025 10:30
item.description: This is fantastic, @hund@fosstodon.org ! Thanks for the nudge! I did try Gadgetbridge a few years ago. They didn’t quite support Garmin then. Gave it a spin just now and looks like they’ve come a long way! So far I’ve been exporting my garmin to my site but nothing like a full fledged app with all the bells and whistles. ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded: This is fantastic, @hund@fosstodon.org ! Thanks for the nudge! I did try Gadgetbridge a few years ago. They didn’t quite support Garmin then. Gave it a spin just now and looks like they’ve come a long way! So far I’ve been exporting my garmin to my site but nothing like a full fledged app with all the bells and whistles. ðŸ”—

item.title: 26 Oct 2025 10:30
item.description:
Immich is pretty neat! It does hog /need a decent machine to run though. I briefly dabbled installing it on an RPi3 a year ago and figured the juice wasn’t worth the squeeze for what I was looking at. I’m pretty content with having all my media on a Nextcloud server where rest of my files reside. This seven year old repurposed laptop on which NC runs In tandem with Tailscale and a digital frame, serves most of my needs for now.

Also love that subtle clink you have going on in the comment form! Pretty crafty! ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded:
Immich is pretty neat! It does hog /need a decent machine to run though. I briefly dabbled installing it on an RPi3 a year ago and figured the juice wasn’t worth the squeeze for what I was looking at. I’m pretty content with having all my media on a Nextcloud server where rest of my files reside. This seven year old repurposed laptop on which NC runs In tandem with Tailscale and a digital frame, serves most of my needs for now.

Also love that subtle clink you have going on in the comment form! Pretty crafty! ðŸ”—
